DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of letters numbers or other characters that specifically identifies a tissue sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the alphanumeric unique identifier used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.
